body_html:
@jmchen-g
I've also follow the style of inception_distributed_train.py (Running it needs 100+GB ILSVRC2012 data set and we are downloading it these days) , based on my above code, I added:
with tf.device('/job:worker/task:%d' % FLAGS.task_index) :
And I removed:

with tf.device(tf.train.replica_device_setter(
                worker_device = "/job:worker/task:%d" % FLAGS.task_index,
                cluster = cluster)) :
       with tf.device('/gpu:%d' % (FLAGS.task_index % FLAGS.gpu_cards)) :

Then I restart the job, still with 1 ps and 2 workers. Then worker 0 still runs smoothly and print out results. Worker 1 hangs inner "sv.prepare_or_wait_for_session"(no error messages are shown).

This is my code: (Added some "print" to locate where to hang)
mnist_softmax.py.txt

body:
@jmchen-g 
I've also follow the style of [inception_distributed_train.py](https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/inception/inception/inception_distributed_train.py) (Running it needs 100+GB ILSVRC2012 data set and we are downloading it these days) , based on my above code, I added:
`with tf.device('/job:worker/task:%d' % FLAGS.task_index) :`
And I removed:

```
with tf.device(tf.train.replica_device_setter(
                worker_device = "/job:worker/task:%d" % FLAGS.task_index,
                cluster = cluster)) :
       with tf.device('/gpu:%d' % (FLAGS.task_index % FLAGS.gpu_cards)) :
```

Then I restart the job, still  with 1 ps and 2 workers. Then worker 0 still runs smoothly and print out results. Worker 1 hangs inner "sv.prepare_or_wait_for_session"(no error messages are shown).

This is my code: (Added some "print" to locate where to hang)
[mnist_softmax.py.txt](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/files/269636/mnist_softmax.py.txt)
